LEFT_ARROW.name: Scrub the value up or down fast

C.name: Change interpolation of selected control points to Cubic

D.name: Toggle the always in the Dope Sheet box on the node’s properties panel. When active, the node always displays in the Dope Sheet, instead of just displaying when its properties panel is open

H.name: Change interpolation of selected control points to Horizontal

K.name: Change interpolation of selected control points to Constant

L.name: Change interpolation of selected control points to Linear

R.name: Change interpolation of selected control points to Catmull-Rom

Z.name: Change interpolation of selected control points to Smooth

E.name: Move cursor to end of selected text

K.name: Delete text from the cursor to the next space

I.name: Display script information, such as the node count, channel count, cache usage, and whether the script is in full-res or proxy mode

L.name: Toggle between Unlocked and Locked 3D view mode for selected Camera or Light

N.name: Launch a new project window in a new instance of Nuke

NUMPAD_SLASH.name: Search by node name or class

S.name: Save script and increment version number

SLASH.name: Search by node name or class

T.name: Cycle through tabs in the current pane. Note that this does not work if the focus is on the input pane of the Script Editor

U.name: Enable or disable previewing output on an external broadcast video monitor

A.name: Select all nodes in the Node Graph or group window

B.name: Node buffer toggle. When this is on, the output from the node is cached or kept in memory, so that it can be read quickly. A yellow line displays under the node to indicate that the caching is on

BACKSLASH.name: Snaps all nodes to the grid.
Snaps selected node to the grid

CONTROL.name: Display connector dots. Drag one to set a dot and create an “elbow.”

D.name: Disconnect upstream node from selected node

DOWN_ARROW.name: Decrement the version number in the selected node’s file name
Selects the previous or next node in the tree

ENTER.name: Open window for selected group node

F.name: Fit the selected nodes  to the Node Graph panel or group window
Generate flipbook for selected node using FrameCycler

G.name: Nest selected nodes inside a Group node, keeping the original nodes in the layout. Ctrl+Enter opens the new Group node
Nest selected nodes inside a Group node, replacing the original nodes with the Group
Replace selected Group node with the nodes nested inside it

HASH.name: Opens a new Viewer window with # representing the number of the connection  you want to establish between the new Viewer and the selected node
Zoom-in by a specific percentage. The # represents a number between 0 and 9, with 0=1000%, 1=100%, 2=200%, 3=300%, 4=400%, 5=500%, 6=600%, 7=700%, 8=800%, and 9=900%
Zoom-out by a specific percentage. The # represents a number between 0 and 9, with 0=10%, 1=100%, 2=50%, 3=30%, 4=25%, 5=20%, 6=16%, 7=14%, 8=12%, and 9=11%

K.name: Insert Copy node. Note that for this to work, you first need to click on the Node Graph to select it. If you have selected the Viewer, pressing K stops playback
Remove selected nodes from clone group

P.name: Toggle proxy resolution, as defined on the Settings properties panel

R.name: Insert a Read node. NOTE:  Pressing R with an existing Read node selected, opens the file browser at the location specified by that node

TAB.name: Open a text field where you can enter the first letters of a node name to bring up a list of matches. Press Return to insert a node from the list

U.name: Splay first selected node to input A
Splay last selected node to input A
Splay selected nodes to first selected node
Splay selected nodes to last selected node

UP_ARROW.name: Increment the version number in the selected node’s file name
Selects the previous or next node in the tree

X.name: Swap A/B inputs on selected node

Y.name: Connect first selected node to the output of the second selected node
Connect second selected node to the output of the first selected node

A.name: Select all nodes in the Properties Bin

DOWN_ARROW.name: Increment  or decrement  the value in a parameter field. Click first on the field or press Tab to move focus to the parameter

R.name: Fit Properties Bin to open panels
Fit Properties Bin to open panels

TAB.name: Move focus to next  or previous  parameter. May need to click on a parameter first, to establish the focus inside the properties panel
Move focus to next  or previous  parameter. May need to click on a parameter first, to establish the focus inside the properties panel
Move to next tabbed page  or the previous tabbed page  in the properties panel
Move to next tabbed page  or the previous tabbed page  in the properties panel

UP_ARROW.name: Increment  or decrement  the value in a parameter field. Click first on the field or press Tab to move focus to the parameter

BACKSPACE.name: Delete an item from the stroke/shape list. Note that if the RotoPaint node is selected in the Node Graph, pressing Backspace deletes the entire node

C.name: Toggle between Clone and Reveal tools

D.name: Toggle between Dodge and Burn tools

E.name: Remove feather outline from selected points

N.name: Toggle between Brush and Eraser tools

Q.name: Toggle between Select All, Select Curves and Select Points tools

SHIFT.name: Drag the transform box points to move them

T.name: Show/hide source as onion skin with transform box/jack

V.name: Toggle between Bezier, B-Spline, Ellipse and Rectangle tools

X.name: Toggle between Blur, Sharpen, and Smear tools

Z.name: Make tangent handles horizontal on selected points

ENTER.name: Run the script in the Editor

LEFT_BRACKET.name: Decrease the indentation level of selected text
Step back to the previous statement

RIGHT_BRACKET.name: Increase the indentation level of selected text
Step forward to the next statement

A.name: Display the alpha channel or the channel displayed in the list at the top of the Viewer
Display “other” channel / RGB toggle. Current input only.

B.name: Display Blue channel / RGB toggle. Current input only

BACKSPACE.name: Activate Wipe. Cycle images on right side
Cycle through Viewer inputs in reverse order. If wipe is active, cycles through inputs on the left-hand side

G.name: Display Green channel / RGB toggle. Current input only

HASH.name: Zoom-in by a specific percentage. The # represents a number between 0 and 9, with 0=1000%, 1=100%, 2=200%, 3=300%, 4=400%, 5=500%, 6=600%, 7=700%, 8=800%, and 9=900%
Zoom-out by a specific percentage. The # represents a number between 0 and 9, with 0=10%, 1=100%, 2=50%, 3=30%, 4=25%, 5=20%, 6=16%, 7=14%, 8=12%, and 9=11%

K.name: Stop playback. Note that for this to work, you first need to click on the Viewer to select it. If you have selected the Node Graph, pressing K inserts a Copy node

L.name: Display Luminance / RGB toggle. Current input only

LEFT_ARROW.name: Move left on the timeline by the specified increment amount
Move to midpoint between current frame and previous keyframe/first frame

M.name: Display Matte / RGB toggle. Current input only
Display Matte, or alpha channel as transparent overlay

P.name: Disable  the display refresh of the Viewer
Open the controls of the currently active Viewer process

With the mouse pointer over the Viewer, this keystroke toggles pixel aspect ratio between square and non-square, according to the setting of the default format under the Settings properties panel. This is not the same as toggling proxy resolution

R.name: Display Red channel / RGB toggle. Current input only
Resize Viewer and image to fit frame
Resize Viewer to maximum and fit image

RIGHT_ARROW.name: Move right on the timeline by the specified increment amount
Move to midpoint between current frame and next keyframe/last frame

SEMICOLON.name: Switch to the previous view in a multi-view project

U.name: Enable or disable previewing output on an external broadcast video monitor
Update Viewer display. Used when Pause is active

W.name: Activate the ROI feature, or if a ROI exists, clear the current ROI. Drag to define a new ROI
Toggles Viewer “blend,” split-screen display, on/off. This was previously called the “wipe” mode.

Z.name: Toggle lock/unlock the Viewer to a specified zoom level for all inputs
